Package imagingbook.lib.math

Class Eigensolver2x2

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.math.Eigensolver2x2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RealEigensolver
    public class Eigensolver2x2
extends java.lang.Object
implements RealEigensolver
    Implements an efficient, closed form algorithm for calculating the real eigenvalues (λ) and eigenvectors (x) of a 2x2 matrix M of the form 
       | A B |
   | C D |
    There are typically (but not in general) two pairs of real-valued solutions ⟨λ1, x1⟩, ⟨λ2, x2⟩ such that M·xk = λk·xk.

    This implementation is inspired by Blinn, Jim: "Jim Blinn's Corner: Notation, Notation, Notation", Morgan Kaufmann (2002) - Ch. 5 ("Consider the Lowly 2x2 Matrix"). Note that Blinn uses the (common computer graphics) notation x·M = λ·x, while this implementation adopts the notation M·x = λ·x, i.e., the matrix M is transposed (elements B/C are exchanged).

    Version:
    2020-02-09

      • getEigenvalues

        public double[] getEigenvalues()
        Returns a vector holding the two real eigenvalues. Both are NaN if the associated matrix has no real eigenvalues. Otherwise the first eigenvalue has greater magnitude than the second. Note that the method returns a reference to an internal array and thus results should be used read-only!
        Specified by:
        getEigenvalues in interface RealEigensolver
        Returns:
        a 2-element array of eigenvalues

      • getEigenvalue

        public double getEigenvalue​(int k)

      • getEigenvectors

        public double[][] getEigenvectors()
        Deprecated.
        Returns a 2x2 array holding the two real eigenvectors. When used in the form 
        double[][] X = getEigenvalues();
        then X[0] and X[1] contain the 1st and 2nd eigenvector, respectively. If the associated matrix has no real eigenvalues, then X[0] and X[1] are both null. Otherwise X[k][0] and X[k][1] are the x/y components of the k-th eigenvector. The ordering of the returned eigenvectors is the same as for the eigenvalues returned by getEigenvalues(). Note that the method returns a reference to an internal array and thus results should be used read-only! Obsolete, use getEigenvector(int) instead.
        Returns:
        a 2-element array of 2D eigenvectors

      • getEigenvector

        public double[] getEigenvector​(int k)
        Returns the k-th eigenvector, with k = 0 or 1. The ordering of the returned eigenvectors is the same as for the eigenvalues returned by getEigenvalues(). Note that the method returns a reference to an internal array and thus results should be used read-only!
        Specified by:
        getEigenvector in interface RealEigensolver
        Parameters:
        k - index (0 or 1)
        Returns:
        the kth eigenvector
